news.title: Google Could Face Antitrust Suits by Summer as DOJ, States Move Toward Decisions
news.description: Federal and state officials are reportedly moving toward initiating antitrust actions against Google after over a year of investigations into tech companies including Amazon and Apple.

news.title: A Private Equity Firm is Blocked From Buying .Org
news.description: The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers, which oversees the Internet naming system, rejected a bid of more than $1 billion for the sale of the rights to dot-org.

news.title: Just Turning Your Phone On Qualifies as Searching It, Court Rules
news.description: A federal judge in Washington has concluded that FBI officials should have had a search warrant to look at the lock screen of a smartphone belonging to a criminal defendant.

news.title: Senate Passes Spying Bill Without Search and Browsing History Protections
news.description: In reauthorizing a Patriot Act-era surveillance law, the US Senate declined to include a provision shielding Americansâ€™ browsing and search histories from warrantless FBI searches.
